revised_title: Tide Irregularities and Observations at Chatham, Sheerness, Woolwich, and Deptford in February 1756
tldr: In February 1756, the authors observed and documented irregularities in the tides at Chatham, Sheerness, Woolwich, and Deptford. They attributed these irregularities to strong winds and gales during that week, which affected the tidal patterns and water levels. The authors also provided detailed accounts of their observations and the impact of wind direction on tidal phenomena.
